column5: Fished out of Cedar Point Lodge from 7/29/2017 to 8/4/2017, I considered fishing excellent.* This was our first time on Eagle Lake, about my 20th trip to Canada, fishing started slow (big lake, it all looks so good for fishing), but things turned around after out Guide Trip day (our first full day on the lake).* It was wonderful conversation, and the guide showed us the How and Where for technique and places to try, boating lots of walleyes that day.* For the whole week 475 walleyes caught (if our count was accurate), and 2 northern pike, spending 12 hours per day fishing, water was 76 to 78 degrees on surface.

Thanks to Mike and Limeyangler both inspired me to post and share video. This is my first attempt at video, created a channel, not sure if that's normal, still trying to figure YouTube out. This one is more of a family slide show.https://youtu.be/4RnMJxYn84g
It is all fun and games until they figure out how to pick the lock on the main gate..... This is how a lodge coup d'etat starts. Before you know it, you are "flocked" PjShorthorn
Or some of these, Left plenty down at the fish cleaning shack

Fished Vermillion and Nash bays on Eagle the 11th of Aug with a guide we have been using for 8 years in hot calm and bright conditions and fishing was tough. 20-30' only and very light bites. lowest numbers ever with this guide who knows his stuff. Had been on Thaddeus during the week and again very slow walleye fishing with most in the camp giving up on walleyes and going musky fishing.

Too bad you only had the one day opportunity. Our experience (ie our guests) was the opposite.......good morning and evening bite happening anywhere from 18 feet and deeper in Vermilion Bay during the week of August 5 -12. Best results from a group that managed to score some leeches when they crossed the border.......but crawlers and minnows were also working. That said, it's fishing and everyone will have a different experience.

We did get onto some fish but mid day fishing was probably not ideal in the conditions but unfortunately we only had one day and had to leave lake by 4pm to travel home. The bite at Thaddeus was very much early day and late evening but slow overall ime
I am bringing the family up to eagle lake out of birch dale. I was wondering if there are any reports on eagle? Will

Was out there last werk for six days.fished the east end and was very good.mainly 14-16" fish and lots of them.few slots and over.basically great days.cant comment onbthiscweek as iam on cedar lake and dontvknow how north and west section is but last week all camp boats were in the east side daily.

Here's a 27 inch I caught 2 days ago on a Rapala Tail Dancer in 17 feet of water. Drop-offs, humps, weeds......all producing at intervals during the day. Crawlers, minnows. A 29 incher released this afternoon by a guest....jig and crawler in 24 feet.
A rare photo of the Red Demon with his "catch of the week". Such a proud moment for him......
Thanks for the info! Will definitely pick up a flat of crawlers then. Will
Everyone knows that is Susanne's fish and you were just nice enough to pick it up out of the net for her. PjShorthorn
This was my "catch of the week" from a couple of years back. It appears that the fishery is improving!!!
Narda, I'm thinking most fish look small when you hold them......that's why Steve Herbeck and Joe Bucher look great holding muskies.....they both are midgets.....
Ha. Well played. Sent from my iPhone using Tapatalk
